Articles.Content: I know you are updating now to 1.4.3... could you please also remove the strict handling of the max KSP version? Your mod is the only one I have installed that does not work with a higher patch version. It's ok for me to get a warning like "not tested with"... but shutting down the system because of this? That's to extreme I think.

20 minutes ago, Rudolf Meier said:

I know you are updating now to 1.4.3... could you please also remove the strict handling of the max KSP version? Your mod is the only one I have installed that does not work with a higher patch version. It's ok for me to get a warning like "not tested with"... but shutting down the system because of this? That's to extreme I think.

I think it was put in place that way for a reason. We've had plenty of warning that 1.4.3 was coming, and modded games are always at risk of breaking when new versions of the main game release. If you want to back up to the previous KSP, you can do that within Steam (I think?) -- and it's always a good idea to make a copy/backup of the steam directory just for this kind of occurrence.

I'm in the same boat as you, though -- I have a game going that probably will have no solar panel functionality until the1.4.3 version is released.  

Edited April 27, 2018 by Beetlecat

2 hours ago, Beetlecat said:

I think it was put in place that way for a reason. We've had plenty of warning that 1.4.3 was coming, and modded games are always at risk of breaking when new versions of the main game release. If you want to back up to the previous KSP, you can do that within Steam (I think?) -- and it's always a good idea to make a copy/backup of the steam directory just for this kind of occurrence.

I'm in the same boat as you, though -- I have a game going that probably will have no solar panel functionality until the1.4.3 version is released.  

Can confirm that you can go back to previous versions of KSP in steam if need be. 

I mean if you don't want to you could mess with the version file, which may make it work, but I have no idea. More likely it would break everything.

Edited April 27, 2018 by Mark Kerbin

5 minutes ago, Mark Kerbin said:

Can confirm that you can go back to previous versions of KSP in steam if need be. 

I mean if you don't want to you could mess with the version file, which may make it work, but I have no idea. More likely it would break everything.

no, unfortunatelly the version file editing doesn't work for Kopernicus (the only mod I've installed that doesn't allow this) and... just because of a patch level, I don't think there is a big chance that it wont work after an update

at least I'm pretty confident and for example marking Infernal Robotics as good to go for every 1.4.x ... I didn't see any problems during 1.4 to 1.4.3 updates... could be sometimes... but... every update is always a risk
Yep. Looks like I will have to uninstall it for the time being. The Steam going 1.4.3 then me reverting seems to have broken it.

17 hours ago, Thomas P. said: 

InnerRadiusMultiplier
{
	key = <angle (degrees)> <multiplier> <in-tangent (optional)> <out-tangent (optional)>
   	// add as many key values as you need
}

Same applies for OuterRadiusMultiplier

Thank you good sir. Will be playing around with that today.

Kopernicus 1.4.3-1 is released on Github!

Changelog: 

- Removed the sun occlusion code again, it will be rereleased in KopernicusExpansion
- Fixed the NullReferenceException spam with terrain scatters
- Updated ModularFlightIntegrator
- Fixed the rings rendering over EVE clouds
- Bodies that are orbiting the main menu body are no longer shown in the main menu
- Updated to KSP 1.4.3

I have also started to do backports of Kopernicus again, this time for KSP 1.3.1. Kopernicus 1.3.1-8 is basically just 1.4.3-1 compiled for 1.3.1.

Link to 1.4.3-1: https://github.com/Kopernicus/Kopernicus/releases/tag/release-1.4.3-1

Link to 1.3.1-8: https://github.com/Kopernicus/Kopernicus-Backport/releases/tag/backport-1.3.1-8
Thank you!
All hail the great @Thomas P., creator of world editing tools, and destroyer of bugs.

1 hour ago, Thomas P. said:

Kopernicus 1.4.3-1 is released on Github!

 

So great! Thank you
Thank you for the update! Now with all the new assets released lately and KK updated, it's time to play in my 2.5x scaled KSP!

Whoops, how badly did I bork my game if I kept playing with kopernicus version locked? I have no active missions outside off of kerbin, so never much went to the tracking station, etc.

I was going to simply test that solar panels work in my sandbox game...

Very Very Badly. (Maybe)

Those panels may be broken. Updating may fix. You probably were fine tho.

1 minute ago, Mark Kerbin said:

Very Very Badly. (Maybe)

Those panels may be broken. Updating may fix. You probably were fine tho.

well, solar panels seem fine -- though now my game has lost about ~25 FPS. That's curious. Not looking forward to this round of troubleshooting

16 minutes ago, Beetlecat said:

well, solar panels seem fine -- though now my game has lost about ~25 FPS. That's curious. Not looking forward to this round of troubleshooting

Well thats a whole new sort of screwed. Had  a similar problem a while ago.

Delete all Kopernious folders and anything using it, remove all MM stuff. Then move in fresh copies . worked for me.

 

BTW do you have SVT installed? that causes mayhem sometimes with updates.

Edited April 28, 2018 by Mark Kerbin

Yeah -- SVT + Eve + Scatterer is the main graphical setup. My current game got wildly cluttered anyway, so I think it may be a good point to reset. I'll try some of the cache clearing first.
